title: 104_hr4208
content:
The "Gun Violence Control Act" includes regulations on the manufacture, importation, and sale of projectiles capable of penetrating police body armor, known as cop-killer bullets. The Gun Violence Control Act expands the definition of armor-piercing ammunition to include projectiles that can penetrate body armor, with regulations on determining their capability within a year of enactment. The regulations under the Gun Violence Control Act require uniform testing of projectiles against Body Armor Exemplar standards developed with the Attorney General. The term 'Body Armor Exemplar' refers to body armor meeting minimum standards for law enforcement officer protection. TITLE II--DOMESTIC VIOLENCE

SEC. 201. DEFINITIONS.

    Amends Section 921(a) of title 18, United States Code to define 'crime involving domestic violence' as a violent crime committed by a current or former spouse, parent, guardian, co-parent, cohabitant, or similar person under domestic violence laws.

SEC. 202. UNLAWFUL ACTS. SEC. 202. UNLAWFUL ACTS. Amends Section 922 of title 18, United States Code to include being under indictment for or convicted of a crime involving domestic violence as an unlawful act. SEC. 203. RULES AND REGULATIONS. Amends Section 926(a) of title 18, United States Code by expanding the list of prohibited firearm offenses. SEC. 204. ADMINISTRATIVE RELIEF FROM CERTAIN FIREARM PROHIBITIONS. Section 925(c) of title 18, United States Code is amended to include exceptions for persons convicted of domestic violence crimes. The amendments also apply to pending applications for relief and judicial reviews. The Act includes provisions for pending judicial reviews and applications for relief filed after its enactment.
